projects.title: Chance and the dissipation of our acts effects
projects.subtitle: Forthcoming in the Australasian Journal of Philosophy
projects.description: This paper discusses the sensitivity of the shape of history to routine actions. It argues that given the possibility of non-deterministic effects, most actions do not have the power to radically alter the shape of the future.

projects.title: Race to A.I.
projects.description:
A game about A. I. safety. You play as a start up trying to be the first to build a strong A. I. system.

[Live](https://derekshiller.com/race_to_ai) [GitHub](https://github.com/dcshiller/race-to-ai)
projects.notes: This game was written as an experiment in functional programming (elm) for the [Philosophy Game Jam #2](https://itch.io/jam/philgamejam-2).

projects.title: Real Safe Cars
projects.description:
A website for displaying statistically sophisticated car safety ratings. The ratings were produced by Ben Shiller and Bhoomija Ranjan and combine real-world data with the safety ratings produced by other agencies. The site is written in React.

[Live](https://realsafecars.com)

projects.title: Happy Mice
projects.description:
A game about trying to make mice happy. 

[Live](http://www.derekshiller.com/happy_mice) [GitHub](https://github.com/dcshiller/happy_mice)
projects.notes: The game was written in React and created between 1/5/19 and 1/12/19 for the [Philosophy Game Jam](https://itch.io/jam/philosophy-game-jam).

projects.title: Interactionism for the discerning mind?
projects.subtitle: [Philosophical Studies 2020](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11098-018-1213-5)
projects.description: This paper argues that interactionists face difficulties making sense of how minds could influence the right neurons in a brain to produce the range of behaviors of which we are capable.

projects.title: HTML Dom Element Data
projects.description:
A collecton of style data drawn from all dom elements on pages I have browsed using a chrome extension and getComputedStyles(). In CSV format.

Available [here](https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/dcs.bucket/dom_data.csv).

projects.title: JSON tractatus
projects.description: A copy of Wittgenstein's Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus, translated into English, in JSON format.

projects.title: Argur
projects.description:
Journal submission management website written in Ruby on Rails. Users can record submissions to journals and upload files associated with those submissions.

[Live](http://argur.derekshiller.com), [Github](https://www.github.com/dcshiller/submission_organizer)

projects.title: The unity of moral attitudes
projects.subtitle: Canadian Philosophy Review 2018
projects.description: This paper suggests that moral attitudes are distinguished from other attitudes by their functional properties in a restricted range of contexts and by the the resemblance of their ingredients in other contexts. This proposal provides a novel solution to the Frege-Geach problem.

projects.title: Neural Network Project
projects.description:
A JavaScript tool for building neural networks. The networks can be hooked up to control the movements of a simple artificial creature. Inspired by the ediacaran trace fossils. 

[Live](http://www.derekshiller.com/nnp/nnp.html)  [Github](http://github.com/dcshiller/nnp)
projects.notes: Networks are drawn on an html canvas that accommodates zooming and scrolling.

projects.title: Philosophy Data Project
projects.description:
A web database for storing philosophy data in a way that is easy to access. Written in Rails. 

Currently down.

[Github](http://github.com/dcshiller/philosophydataproject)

projects.title: Where Do They Publish?
projects.description:
A tool written as an experiment with Go. This program queries for articles by author and compiles them, listing where the given authors publish. The data is very incomplete.

[live](http://wheredotheypublish.derekshiller.com)

projects.title: Piper
projects.description:
Game in which you must move titles to connect pipes before time runs out. Inspired by nostalgia for [Pipe Mania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pipe_Mania).

 [Live](http://www.derekshiller.com/piper/piper.php)  [Github](https://github.com/dcshiller/piper)
projects.notes: Final JavaScript project at App Academy.

projects.title: Turing Machine Simulator
projects.description:
Written in ruby, this program allows the user to create and run Turing machine programs from the terminal. This little program can solve any computable problem! 

This was developed as an experiment for what I could do in a terminal. 

[Github](http://www.github.com/dshiller/turingmachine)

projects.title: ForMu
projects.description:
React + Rails project for making and sharing forms. Modeled on WuFoo.



Final rails project at App Academy. 

[Live](http://formu.derekshiller.com/) [Github](http://github.com/dcshiller/formu)

projects.title: In defense of artificial replacement
projects.subtitle: [Bioethics 2017](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/bioe.12340)
projects.description: This paper reflects on the significance of Savulescu's principle of procreative beneficence for the long-term future of the human species.

projects.title: Hidden qualia
projects.subtitle: [Review of Philosophy and Psychology 2017](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s13164-015-0297-5)
projects.description: In this paper, I propose that those who reject higher-order theories of consciousness should not rule out the possibility of having conscious experiences that they cannot introspect.

projects.title: The problem of other attitudes
projects.subtitle: American Philosophical Quarterly 2017
projects.description: This paper discusses how noncognitivists might extend their accounts of moral judgments to other kinds of moral attitudes, such as moral hopes and moral intuitions.

projects.title: A Primitive Solution to the Negation Problem
projects.subtitle: [Ethical Theory and Moral Practice 2016](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10677-015-9670-9)
projects.description: This paper suggests that metaethical expressivists should be unbothered by a large number of brute norms and hence that they should be free to postulate their way out of Unwin's negation problem.

projects.title: Engage with animal welfare in conservation (with Nitin Sekar)
projects.subtitle: [Science](https://science.sciencemag.org/content/369/6504/629)
projects.description: We aregue that conservatinist organizations should make institutional changes to better promote the welfare of individual animals.
